page.title: 03Farming in Knockholt
page.content: Much of the land is owned by the Chevening Estate, which is rented out to three farmers, one of them having three farms as one unit. Three other farms cover most of the remaining farm land. There are both pastoral and arable farming with a little more of the latter, which has increased in the last ten years. Oats, wheat, barley, oilseed rape, peas, beans, lucerne and maize are all grown for both human and animal consumption. Spring beans are sometimes sent to Germany where they are ground and mixed with the flour. The l985 harvest was very difficult due to the wet spring and summer and some of the crops planned for human use had to be sold for animal feed. Straw is baled for bedding, in large, round or square bales or small bales for private horse owners. Silage and hay are made.
